      This function will fo through the arr of coins once and calculate the move of amir and tamar according to tamar logic and amir logic, pick the values in the index where the sum of that indexes is bigger(even or odd indexes) according to the flag isOddBigger that determinate which indexes to choose and finally print their paths int the game and the final score Time comlexity = 8*n + O(printMove) + 3 = 10n + 3 = O(n) Space complexity = O(1) - final, no allocation using variables;

      • win

        public static void win​(int[] arr)
        Prints the path of the game according to tamar and amir choices
        Parameters:
        arr - - array of coins for the game. must be even length.

      • isOddBigger

        public static int isOddBigger​(int[] arr,
                              int evenSum,
                              int oddSum,
                              int i)
        Calculate the sum of coins in the even indexes and odd indexes to know which indexes should amir pick to win work recursivley to find the sums, go through the array one time Time complexity = 2*n + 1 = O(n) Space complexity = O(1) - final, no allocation using variables;
        Parameters:
        arr - - array of coins for the game. must be even length.
        evenSum - - the current sum of even indexes, carry through all recursive calls when running on the array
        oddSum - - the current sum of odd indexes, carry through all recursive calls when running on the array
        i - - the current index of the array for checking the value in that array index
        Returns:
        1 if odd is bigger and 0 if if even is bigger or equal

      • printPath

        public static void printPath​(int[] arr,
                             int isOddBigger,
                             int low,
                             int high,
                             int amirSum,
                             int tamarSum)
        This function will fo through the arr of coins once and calculate the move of amir and tamar according to tamar logic and amir logic, pick the values in the index where the sum of that indexes is bigger(even or odd indexes) according to the flag isOddBigger that determinate which indexes to choose and finally print their paths int the game and the final score Time comlexity = 8*n + O(printMove) + 3 = 10n + 3 = O(n) Space complexity = O(1) - final, no allocation using variables;
        Parameters:
        arr - - array of coins for the game. must be even length.
        isOddBigger - - the flag that determinate which indexes amir should take to win
        low - - the current lowest index in the game
        high - - the current highest index in the game
        amirSum - - the current sum for amir in the game
        tamarSum - - the current sum for tamar in the game

      • printMove

        public static void printMove​(int[] arr,
                             java.lang.String player,
                             int i)
        This function will print which player took what value according to what she get Time complexity - O(1) Space complexity - O(1) - final, no allocation using variables;
        Parameters:
        arr - - array of coins for the game. must be even length.
        player - - the name of the player
        i - - the index of the value that the player took
